website_summaries.verdict: This can crusher is a reliable and durable good value for the money.
pros: Works for both 12 and 16 ounce cans
Hangs flat on the wall when not in use
cons: Loads only one can at a time
Cans can have a tendency to slip out of the crusher quickly after being crushed

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Not a whole lot to say. Crushes cans well. Is very well built. Excellent deal for for the price. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great Can Metal Crusher
customer_reviews.text: Great can crusher. I used a vise grip to bend up and create a lip on the base where the can rest to keep the can from slipping out when I applied downward pressure to crush the can. (Adding a photo of the bend in the base. Excuse the dirt but I use this crusher a lot.) Apply some WD 40 or Garage Door lubricant to all moving hinge and pinion points before using. This will ensure ease of operation and extend the life of the crusher.I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: BeGreatful

customer_reviews.title: NO RETURNS ALLOWED on Defective product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Poorly built and NO RETURNS ALLOWED!!! I ordered one and discovered I was charged for and shipped 2 of them. When I received them, they were BOTH DEFECTIVE and NO returns or refunds. I'm stuck with, not one, but TWO defective crushers! As you can see in the photos, the CENTER bracket to which the arm mounts is NOT CENTERED and results in the part that is suppose to crush the cans coming out of its track repeatedly. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!! You will regret it.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: The product I received looks just like the picture
customer_reviews.text: The product I received looks just like the picture. I just received it yesterday and it has works great so far. I have not attached it to a post/wall yet and have used it on top of a counter with a rag underneath it. It feels very sturdy and has crushed about 20 cans so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amethystar

customer_reviews.title: So bummed it broke!**REVISED- AMAZON REFUNDED MY MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this because it was so heavy duty and so well reviewed but within the first month of having it installed it broke! And just to be clear, it's just me and my husband, no abusive can crushers here! I don't know what to do, not sure if I got a defective one but I'm hoping maybe I can get a replacement and have a better experience. If so, I'll replace this review. Fingers crossed!**REVISION- Amazon was kind enough to refund my money for this purchase. Not sure if I will buy another one, a little apprehensive after the last one but the reviews make me want to try!
customer_reviews.author: M. Ay

customer_reviews.title: Works Great So Far
customer_reviews.text: So far holding up great, crushed approximately 30 cans with it. It handles 12 oz cans easily, more force is required for 16 oz cans but it does the job. Due to my current living situation I could not mount it to a wall stud, instead I mounted it to a spare 2x4 I had and clamped it to my work bench firmly, but it could also just be left on the ground and work just as well. My work bench is sturdy so I prefer to have it at waist height. I like how simple the design is and with it mounted to a separate 2x4 I can remove it when it is not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Duke VonMeep

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and not returnable
customer_reviews.text: I installed the crusher and after just a few pulls, I noticed the entire mechanism was "dragging" and scraping the paint off of the inner surface. After a little look, I noticed that the upper bracket is not centered, and therefore the entire mechanism is not in alignment with the body. Worse of all... this item is not returnable. I didn't even know such a thing existed on Amazon. Looks like others are having the same issue, so good luck to you. Maybe you will get a good one for your $23. I didn't. Amazon should be up front in the ad about items that are not returnable. Might lead to more responsibility by their vendors.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Hinge broken in only four months
customer_reviews.text: The left hinge popped out. It appears the handle portion was not formed with a width close to the width of the can holder, so the hinge rubbed on the inside and wore the hinge metal away where it was expanded so it would stay in the hole. The hinge then popped out of its socket and there's over a quarter inch gap between the handle and the holder. If the handle width had been narrower--closer to the width of the can holder, the strain on the inside of the hinge would not have been as great and it wouldn't have worn through.
customer_reviews.author: d n s

customer_reviews.title: Complete Train Wreck!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I read the few negative reviews about this thing coming apart... the parts being misaligned and crooked... parts rubbing. Well, despite the warnings, I decided to give it a go. Ugh! My until is an absolute train wreck. The mechanisms are all misaligned, completely crooked, parts rubbing... I mean, the manufacturer for this unit should be fired! My unit came apart after 15 cans. What kind of junk is this?! To top it off... NO REFUNDS!!! Amazon should pull this immediately. It's an embarrassment. It's probably the biggest POS I've ordered on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: SlappyJames

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, If Not Quite Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like it - easy to use and crushes cans thoroughly. One thing that could be improved - there's nothing holding the can inside but gravity. When a can is crushed, its center of gravity moves in a random pattern, so there's a fair chance the can will fall out the front of the crusher as you're mashing on the handle. (I don't recommend holding the can in with your other hand, as you might injure yourself.) This doesn't happen too often, though. Other than that it's a nice accessory in my home - frees up a good amount of space in the recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: Remy's Uncle

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect
customer_reviews.text: Growing up, my family had a wall-mount that was very weak and was more trouble than just stomping on the cans, so I was reluctant to buy any crusher. After my kids and I got tired of all the stomping and bothering the neighbors in our apartment complex, I reluctantly ordered this. And I'm not all disappointed!! It's VERY sturdy. I use it on the floor of the kitchen, which requires two hands but also means that I don't have to worry about holes in any walls. For speed's sake I dent each can before crushing. I think if it were mounted on a wall that wouldn't be necessary.
customer_reviews.author: TANICIA LENAY PERRY

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but poorly built
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a nice product, but it is misaligned and therefore difficult to use. You can see in the photos how off kilter the piston is. This causes it to scrape the side, making it harder to operate. You can see the paint its scraped off after only a few uses in the second pic. No amount of lubrication has helped. Since it's put together with rivets, there's no way to disassemble and repair it. All-in-all, a pretty disappointing purchase. Oh, it also came short one mounting screw, so I had to find a replacement before I could install it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry N

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Durable. Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: After finding the stud on my garage wall, installation was easy for this well-built can crusher. It came with a paper template for the screw hole markings which was very helpful during installation. This crusher accommodates the average sized soda or beer can nicely. Anything larger really doesn't fit inside the crushing chamber. Very happy because use of this product puts an end to the multitudes of bags headed for the recycling center. We're very pleased with this product and may even get one for our cabin in the woods. 😁
customer_reviews.author: MJ in CA

customer_reviews.title: Arrived warped and scraped up. Watch out! Not returnable either
customer_reviews.text: This arrived today- warped. Barely able to open it - the back was scraped up like it has been used before. After speaking to customer service I found out it was ineligible for return. So that’s pretty scammy. Fortunately Amazons customer service covered the cost of the item. Very disappointed in quality control. Be wary.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L.

customer_reviews.title: This is the Cadillac of Can Smashers
customer_reviews.text: I finally wore my old on out after 19yrs and thousands of cans....Literally wore the plunger though the back of the unit...Rounded the edges off the plunger and it wouldn't stay level anymore.....If you want a good one this is IT...the other kind with the arms on them...the rivets break after awhile......Amazon had the cheapest price on it too $23.99 plus tax.....Fast Shipping Too.....Way cheaper than Walmart $60 and cheaper than Ebay $26 ....Do what you want , But I recommend this one.....
customer_reviews.author: Heavymetaltrax

customer_reviews.title: Crushes 16 ounce (tall) and 12 ounce cans!
customer_reviews.text: This was the second choice of can crusher that I ordered. After just a few uses, the handle on the other one bent! I returned it and replaced it with the Crusher. The Crusher was easy to install in the garage and easy to use. The rubber cover on the handle makes it more comfortable when one has a large number of cans to crush. The cans do, occasionally, pop out of the Crusher. I just put them back in and hold them in place carefully to finish the job. Overall, a great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Ursula Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worth it !
customer_reviews.text: i was able to crush all my cand that accumulated in my backyard without any hesitation and much faster that doing them with the foot . It is a very simple product to use although there might be some soda cans that pop out but it ain’t no problem . Placed on a board like many other reviewers and found a good spot to crush those cans . It work well up to those 16 oz cans but anything taller it won’t be able to fit . The built quality is very good and very heavy duty not like those plastic can crushers , I haven’t had any problems with it so far ,l. Definitely recommend this product .
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Santiago

customer_reviews.title: WORKS LIKE A TANK!
customer_reviews.text: The CRUSHER! is just that! It works every time with ease. I wanted a can crusher that was durable and could last the use and abuse of soda and aluminum can crushing! The CRUSHER! does it every time. I've CRUSHED hundreds of cans and it works as if I had just unboxed it every time! If you want a quality CRUSHER that is made of a sturdy metal that is not flimsy or poorly constructed... Then the CRUSHER is the obvious choice! You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: cortezed

customer_reviews.title: WARNING THIS PRODUCT IS AWFUL!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this is a piece of junk and seller does not accept returns. Mounted it on a stud just like is suggested. Every time I go to crush a can the metal rubs so bad and loud its hard to push down to crush. I keep putting lube works for a few times more but it keeps doing the same thing. Don’t waste your money on this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan b.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this one over any other as this is built sturdier than the others. This one is the second one I have had, the first was in my old house and still there and still works great after 18 years! The second is in my new house and works great! Just had to use a little lubricant spray and good to go. The one little tip I found on you tube is when you put a can in to crush push a little on center of the can and crush flat.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Pindjak

customer_reviews.title: Temporary product, cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: So this crushes cans pretty good. Like the other reviews say, bending the can first helps a lot. Also, smaller cans work better. I was pretty shocked that some of the parts are rusting as you can see in the picture. I mounted it to a pallet in my backyard. This is after two and a half months of sitting outside in Arizona (very little rain). Once the rust gets bad enough, I will replace parts and make modifications. Update: Lasted 1 year before the internals broke. Not very impressed. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Well made but not fast if you have a lot to get through
customer_reviews.text: At first I really liked the idea of having a fancy can compactor instead of stomping on them. But it is kind of more work in a way. You have to grab each can and set them up and take them out. I do 20-30 cans and I’m over it. My favorite way is using a dirt compactor (8x8 heavy square metal plate with a handle) set up all the cans spaced out and just go to town. Gets them super flat in half the time and way less work! But this product is decently Made, it does its job for the most part. Not sure if I would recommend it though...
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Near 5LBS of crushing power.
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty can crusher, weighing near 5LBS, which we have yet to install (instead just setting on a flat surface to use). Made in Mexico (would have preferred USA) but solid. Crushing small and average soda pop cans, plus the tall energy drinks. The easiest way to use is putting a small thumb impression dent in the lower third of the can to make the crushing a tad smoother. Metal housing is thick. The handle is sturdy. The action is smooth. The pics included are of the product, after having crushed hundreds of cans. We would buy this again because of How sturdy this turned- out to be.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Works good with a couple of complaints. 1st - the top cuts into your drywall etc. when the crusher is opened fully. It really needs to be mounted on some plywood or something to give the top an inch or so gap. 2nd - the crusher bottom has no angle to help get the can crusher started so it takes more force in the beginning. I have a smaller crusher with less leverage that crushes cans easier due to the small angle on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J.

customer_reviews.title: Have to crease can and line it up just right or it comes shooting out
customer_reviews.text: Our old crusher in the garage I'd just reach out the door and crush and it would fall into the recycling container below. This can crusher, I have to squeeze the can and line it up just right and come all the way out to the garage and face the crusher to get the can to crush right. Otherwise it pops out of the crusher, which is really annoying. When I get it all lined up right the can is completely crushed, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: stchuckmom

customer_reviews.title: No Return for unopened box!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help manage recycle cans for our Boy Scout troop. Unfortunately found it can’t be used for that purpose since the Scout cans need to display the bar code. Ok, so we wanted to return unopened box. Amazon says this item can’t be returned but provides no explanation why. Nothing in the description warns of this policy. Box is unopened! Scouts lose out. No good!
customer_reviews.author: HWD

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC, not aligned properly
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that I received a faulty crusher. The curhsing mechanism is not aligned with the left track. I have tried to bend with tools but to no avail. How they do not test a quick up and down motion is beyond me. Unfortunately Amazon doesn't accept returns. Honestly, the construction seems strong otherwise, but my unit seems dangerous to use in it's current state. I do not feel it's fair that I'd have to order another unit to remedy this. Would not recommend as the QC is weak as demonstrated.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen J. Chmielewski

customer_reviews.title: Just needs some grip to keep cans from sliding out when crushed
customer_reviews.text: This unit works well for crushing cans. The only complaint that I have is that cans fly out when you try to crush them because the bottom of the unit is so slick that it doesn't grip the can. This could be easily fixed by the manufacturer with a little engineering effort. I fixed mine by adding a very thin layer of Loctite Stik 'n Seal Outdoor Adhesive to the base. The soft flexible adhesive has lasted about a year now with no issues and cans never fly out anymore. With that one minor modification, this is a great product that should last many years.
customer_reviews.author: GolfNut

customer_reviews.title: Crushing it!
customer_reviews.text: Since I cannot bring cans in for buy-back now (COVID-19) I had to find a way to minimize the space cans are taking in my garage...this can crusher CRUSHES IT! It's HEAVY and industrial feeling. It came with a convenient template for hanging. I pre-drilled holes and mounted it into a plywood cabinet with the LONG screws provided. VERY sturdy. Crushes cans just as intended!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Crushes a can, that's all its supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small shop and from time to time we enjoy premium adult malt beverages in there, I decided to save space in the trash can and reclaim some cash from our efforts and would just as soon use my built in crusher (foot) than spend money on a device to compact my empty containers of bad decisions. This thing swayed me because of one thing... its not plastic. I figured i'd give it a shot and what do you know, it crushes cans. There you go, that all of the review you should need unless you decide to avoid my mistake and save your money by using your shoe.
customer_reviews.author: john finley

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid. Perfect as a stress reliever.
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher is rock solid. It's more expensive than others but you get what you pay for. This thing can crush cans all day long and won't quit. Pulling down the handle is almost satisfying and I would highly suggest you keep several empty cans nearby and ready to get your aggression out by crushing a few cans when needed. It's a great stress reliever. Just pretend it's something other than a can in the crusher and BOOM!! all your troubles go away.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Strong and well designed lever.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. As others have mentioned, dimple the cans first but dont crush the sides. The can will collapse easier. This is so sturdy. Wouldn't try to crush steel cans but aluminum containers are a breeze. Cant imagine this every wearing out. Dont get in a hurry, because there is a lot of levered power in the handle and crushing mechanism. Keep hand away that is not pulling lever.
customer_reviews.author: Wichita

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as reveiwed by others...
customer_reviews.text: Sounds like all the other reviews are correct. 2nd can popped out. Floor of unit is raised up in a stamped X pattern thats too slippery. Needs a rubber grip surface. The top compacting surface might benifit from this too. Thought it said it didnt come with fasteners... it did! But only helpfull if you find solid wood to attach to. I went and bought wall anchors.
customer_reviews.author: Pudknocker71

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this product in September and it's broken by November. We noticed that the crushing mechanism was rough from the start. For the price, I expected a smooth pull, but this machine's hinges ground as the lever was pulled down. The other thing I didn't like from the start was the can doesn't stay in place. The crushing lever tends to kick the bottom of the can out so that the only way to get a good crush is to hold the can as you're pulling the handle. It's really inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Crushes cans good!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdier then I thought! Hung it up and started crushing me some cans! Comes in white, has a "The Crusher" logo on it. I hung it on the back deck, near the garbage can, and it works very well. I sprayed some silicon lube on the moving parts, as it was a little stiff right out of the box. Nice and smooth and the finish is good. Not much to rave about: crushes tin cans! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wrangler65

customer_reviews.title: Simple but very effective!
customer_reviews.text: I had this can crusher in my parents house many years ago. We crushed several thousand cans over the years. Skip forward many years and now it's our turn to have one. Works as good as the one we had growing up. Several others have commented about a trick. Insert can and press in on the center of the can with your finger. It will crease a little and the can will lock in place to be crushed. Removal is easy. Will have many years of can crushing with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Darren T Wall

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to be functional.
customer_reviews.text: I overall like the product quality but I haven’t been able to use it at all. I may have got a bad apple but it’s VERY hard to move the handle up and down on the product I received. I’ve tried moving it some to see if the hinges loosened, and I’ve also tried oiling it but it doesn’t seem to be helping. Also even though it hasn’t really been used there are already track marks on one side, so I believe the product is just unaligned. Writing the review hoping amazon will replace since it’s not giving me the option.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylene

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work well at all...waste of time.
customer_reviews.text: I was very dissatisfied with this purchase. I went with this one based on the reviews, and it definitely didn’t live up to the expectations. The cans just pop out about 50% of the time, and on every full stroke the slide comes out of the crushing chamber and has to be pushed back in. The unit was installed correctly, directly into the wall studs. Of course there is no return policy...
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Enduring Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement of a previous identical Crusher that I purchased 16 yrs ago; used monthly for aluminum recycling. Recently, one of the hinges failed simply by metal-to-metal wear; associated to the “construction technique”. I expect this replacement to be equally enduring. And. I can fix the old one. A superb product; never have used a different one. Don’t need to 🤓👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Richard Carter

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably Beefy, bent a bit
customer_reviews.text: The inner bracket on mine was bent. I had to work on it with some pretty big pliers to straighten it out. Looks like the QC could use a little help. They are using some pretty decent gage metal so I think it will hold up over the long term. Reasonably happy with the purchase. Installation is a breeze of course.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Baty

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Crusher I've owned. The first one lasted over 15 years. It was used constantly. The inside moving parts finally wore out. I thought about trying to fix it. I decided against it. Then I thought about trying a different brand or style, but decided not to. Why change a good thing. I'm going for twenty years with this second one. I would recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Great in concept. Poor in execution (poor construction due to sloppy tolerances)
customer_reviews.text: The bend tolerances are such that the ram does not ride under the lip that is clearly supposed to keep it contained. I can also see that things will likely bend and flex as this thing gets used. Parts rub and there is no lubrication so the paint was scratched off from the very first pull. I don't think this will last ... I give it high marks for concept but only two stars for execution. I looked at all of the reviews and pictures for the dozens of different can crushers Amazon sells and they all are poorly designed or poorly made. Can't anyone actually make a basic can crusher that will last?
customer_reviews.author: Kurt S.

customer_reviews.title: Worst Amazon purchase ever! Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage! This is the worst product I’ve ever purchased on Amazon. We cannot even open it to insert a can. It seems to be jammed - and it’s not eligible for return?!? I’ll be calling Amazon today to report it.
customer_reviews.author: K King

customer_reviews.title: Find something else.
customer_reviews.text: Exremely stiff, noisy and not easy to operate out of the box. All 16oz cans slip out of crusher. Probably will do some of the modifications listed on other reviews...shouldn't have to, but NO RETURNS on this piece of cr*p. Don't buy unless you want to work on your new purchase.
customer_reviews.author: VA

customer_reviews.title: Faulty design
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 of these for Christmas gifts and myself. Got them in October and didnt put it up for a couple of months. Now with 3 months of use the rivet has popped out and it's no longer a can crusher. Sorry I got so many. It worked great until it didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S

customer_reviews.title: Tough, Sturdy Can Crusher
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this can crusher for a couple weeks, but it is a sturdy high-quality can crusher. It is exactly what we needed. I would purchase The Crusher again. I use it on the floor in the garage as we are renters at the moment, and I don't want to install it on the wall. It works really well, even on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality can crusher....with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher is made to last (had a cheaper one, it broke within two months). You won't be replacing this one any time soon. HOWEVER - good luck trying to keep the can still while you're trying to crush it. There is nothing there to stop the can from popping out as the crusher mechanism is coming down on it other than holding it there with your free hand, which means you might accidentally pinch your fingers in the aluminum as it is collapsing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty but huge design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher is heavy duty but it has a pretty bad design flaw. The can almost ALWAYS shoots out when I’m crushing it. I’ve seen other customers bend the bottom portion up to help but I shouldn’t have to do that, the company should do a very simple redesign so that I’m not constantly chasing after cans that fly out annoyingly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Family

customer_reviews.title: Not eligible for return.
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these in the pas and it worked awesome for years. I ordered this one when the one I bought at harbor freight broke. This one is the same as the from way back when the handle is narrower and looks like it might be defective as one side looks bent and one does not. I tried to go to return/replace but Amazon says this Item is not eligible for return. The selling page says it's Amazons choice and prime. Not sure why it is not returnable. Disappointed in this
customer_reviews.author: Frank N.

customer_reviews.title: Handles big cans
customer_reviews.text: The CRUSHER easily flattens skinny tall, 12 oz cans, regular 12 oz cans, and the tall, wide 16 oz cans. I can't give it 5 stars, though, because it occasionally ejects partially crushed cans straight at the person doing the crushing. Another minor complaint is that I usually have to remove crushed cans (the ones that don't fly out at me) by hand. The packaging says the crusher should automatically force the cans out so they drop into whatever receptacle you use to collect them.
customer_reviews.author: S. Potter

customer_reviews.title: One good can crusher!
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheap version of this for years and every time someone used a tall can I had to revert to stomping them! No more stomping, this one crushes them all! My granddaughter got me started on the recycle and I will continue to recycle all that my city will accept! Good product and reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.author: hardyman

customer_reviews.title: Just no!
customer_reviews.text: If I could choose zero stars, I would. The product is impossible to use without first denting the center of the can. The instruction manual states you can stack up to six cans and that they will be ejected into your recycling bin. The unit will only hold one can and there is no ejection. On top of the disappointment in the product, it can not be returned so I will be throwing the money spent on it in the trash, along with the unit. Do not purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: This crusher is powerful, very sturdy. I have friends who have used this model for many years. However, the description stated that you could stack cans and they would drop, crushed, one by one. Not true. The only drawback is that I have to put a fitted piece of non-slip shelving pad in the bottom to keep the can from popping out while crushing. That pad needs to be replaced every couple of months. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: mt shopper

customer_reviews.title: Solid All Metal construction
customer_reviews.text: Strong all metal construction. Almost every other can crusher I have found in this price range is 90% plastic. Mine was VERY stiff to raise and lower, but I slapped on some White Lithium Grease to all the parts I could reach and it seems a little better. Once mounted, it moves easier and crushes cans well. As other reviewers may have pointed out, slightly dimple the side of the can with your fingers and the can crushed much easier. I mounted mine to a stud using the 3 screws provided at the top and used a Simpson StrongDrive #8 Panhead on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: The Big V

customer_reviews.title: Great product, especially after my DIY modification
customer_reviews.text: Great product, solid construction and smashes 12oz soda cans very flat. After reading several reviews on Amazon about the handle opening too much and damaging the wall, I decided to modify mine to fix that problem. I drilled an 1/8" hole about 8" from the bottom and put a screw in it which prevents the handle from opening all the way. We only crush soda cans so we don't need it to open any more than that. If you try this, make sure you use a screw with a flat head so the handle can close over it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Well designed can crusher.
customer_reviews.text: It helps to get the can centered before pulling down the crushing mechanism. I have a lot of cans pop out because of how I place the cans. Popped out cans don’t crush as intended and they are more like smashing them with your foot. Also, be careful they don’t get wedged in the can crusher.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Works great nice and heavy duty made, works with ease and squashes the can into a small puck which means more then tripling the size of my recycling compasity, easy to mount with 4 screws, I mounted on dry wall so I used plastic screw anchors so it would hold in place with the constant use, if you can't mount to metal or wood and need to mount to drywall like me, make sure you use screw anchors, not the push in blue ones, but the plastic or metal screw type, they are far stronger
customer_reviews.author: Endevour32

customer_reviews.title: Best crusher on the market no doubt
customer_reviews.text: Yall this is not a cheap plastic can crusher. Its called THE CRUSHER for a reason no other manual crusher amounts to it. This is 100% all metal. I bought one used 5 years ago and the inly problem i have was the handle popped off, easy fix just went to the hardware store and put a bolt in it and slid the handle sleeve back over the bolt. Gave that one to a friend and bought a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Alex T.

customer_reviews.title: Crushes and crushes and crushes
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy a long bit extender to be able to put the screws in, other than that no issues. I had been saving my cans and my 9 yr old grandson started crushing away. Crushes cans down to about 1.5 inches thick. He loved it so well I bought him one to use at his house. Probably have done 200 cans and I see no issues other than an already bent can will sometimes fly out before completely crushed.
customer_reviews.author: BigBallD

customer_reviews.title: This thing is junk right out of the box. Crusher isn’t aligned and is hard to open and close
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. Why is it rated so well? I just opened the box, the entire thing is painted, but when you open it and close it without a can, the crushed scrapes the sides the paint off of the inside. It’s as if it doesn’t align or is bent. I haven’t used it and don’t plan to... I’ll be sending it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great crusher for daily use
customer_reviews.text: Over a year of daily use and it's still holding up great. I really appreciate that it will crush a variety of can sizes. The only modification I made was to remove the logo sticker since it was going to be mounted in our kitchen. This was very easy to do and now the crusher blends into the kitchen fairly well. A regular visitor just noticed it the other day and asked how long we've had it - took him a year to see it!
customer_reviews.author: Petunia

customer_reviews.title: Is not aligned correctly and clicks.
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if I got a defective one or it was just tossed around before it got here but it does not open smoothly. It actually scratches the interior side and also clicks when opening because i need to apply a good amount of force. Check out the video. Unfortunately it makes it difficult to use. It looks like the hinge was placed crooked. Would be 5 star if that gets fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting & Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these crushers on my wall. Have had it there for over 12 years. This is the third crusher that I have bought for myself, I have one outside on a tree. I have also bought 2 as gifts for friends. A very dependable product. If you are looking for a can crusher, this is the ONE!!
customer_reviews.author: Byrddog

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and works well!
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Bending the bottom edge upward so that cans can't slip out was a great recommendation by many other reviewers of this product. Additionally, placing in bolts with washers through the holes on top will insure that this product does not wear out anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: It totally crushes cans, but.....
customer_reviews.text: You have to use 1 hand to hold the can in place while you get it started otherwise the can will shoot out across the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Allen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is very sturdy. And the handle seems improved from previous versions that I read about in other reviews. Lubing the joints is a good idea. And definitely squeeze the can by hand before inserting in the crusher. Definitely makes it easier to start. I mounted mine directly above my recycle bin in the laundry room, and it is very easy to crush before tossing into the bin. Very very happy with the quality of the device :)
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Redding

customer_reviews.title: The Crusher crushes it- most of the time
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher was easy to install and after a few weeks of use, it is holding up fine. There are three things that I'd love to change about the crusher. The first is the location of the inside screw. When you crush a can, it often catches on this bottom screw. Secondly, this crusher cannot handle some of the taller beer cans, so you have to partially crush the can to get it to fit. Lastly, if there was some sort of guide, you would not have to hold the can in place while you crush it. This is more of an issue with the taller cans, but its an issue.
customer_reviews.author: William G

customer_reviews.title: Kinda bad
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived bent and before crushing a single can was already pealing paint...😢 On the 10th can one had fallen down to the handle and almost cuting me with the can shreaded facing towards my palm.
customer_reviews.author: Namr

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy at first, no for long.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy at first, over the course of a few months of use it began to fail. The plate that crushes popped out of alignment and now cans fly out of the crusher instead of being crushed. With brute force I can get it back into alignment but it only lasts for a few uses until it’s back out of alignment. Emailed manufacturer and no response. Given the weight and materials used I’m surprised it didn’t last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This thing needs to be attached to a 2x4 or post. Once you have attached it to something stable, it works amazing. I always thought I could crush a can well by stomping on it. This crusher works much better then any other method. It also crushes 16oz cans!
customer_reviews.author: Henry Qi

customer_reviews.title: Crushing it. Can slip out sometimes...ouch!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Make Can crushing fun and saves so much space. I have it installed right into the exposed wood in the garage. It is a little wobbly after some heavy use , but I may need to check my installation. Only issue is that sometimes cans slip out and then your hand comes down hard. The can goes flying. It is best used if the can is not precrushed at all. I try to nudge the can up against either side where there is a small lip to held hold the can in place. I would enlarge this lip. I am not saying this is toddler friendly, but it feels safer that the open designs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great. However the holes for the screws at the ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a hard time finding one locally. I ordered and it arrived quickly. It works great. However the holes for the screws at the bottom are more than 1 3/4 inches apart. I'm not sure how they expect you to mount it to a stud on the bottom? I drilled a home in the center this way it was mounted securely to the stud on top and bottom. It does work great with cans. The heavy Tin cans required a lot of force to crush. It worked, even though it was designed for aluminum cans. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: onegigabite

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, not well made product
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box the crusher mechanism was out of alignment so it would pop out of the tracks. The mechanism was very hard and was bound up due to the misaligned and bent hinges.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne D.

customer_reviews.title: Crush It, And Crushed it
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how many thousand cans I have crushed with this item, but it is, literally, thousands. Even after all that, the crusher is still doing as advertised (crushing cans). Amazon delivery was spot on, as usual. They have never been late with a shipment (that didn't come from China).
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: First of all this is not for your 90 year old grandmother. This crusher is a bit hard to use then others but it does the job. I purchased this in order to crush the taller cans. I planned on keeping my other crusher up, however after using the Crusher on a couple of cans, I pulled my old can crusher down. I am now in the process of crushing all my previously crushed cans. The Crusher does such a great job I was able to 40% more cans in a bag. I would recommend this to anyone serious about recycling and crushing cans.
customer_reviews.author: charlesghutch

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but not without effort
customer_reviews.text: Crushes cans really well. (Tip: squeeze each can to bend it before you put it in the crusher. It makes it a whole lot easier.) I used it without attaching it to the wall and it works fine on the carpet or a towel. I live in an apartment, but if I had a garage, I would attach it to a wall. It might be easier to use if it were attached to the wall though.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Gowdy

customer_reviews.title: Monster of all can crushers. A++ purchase
customer_reviews.text: **update 6/21/19 my dad loved it so much I just bought him a second for his lake house. Great product!!!! The monster of all can crushers. I looked at every one online. Read all reviews. And kept coming back to this one because hands down it’s a solid metal frame. My dad was thrilled! And he is hard to impress with contraptions! You will not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year
customer_reviews.text: We used this thing pretty reliably for just about a year, and today a part of the arm just totally broke with no clear way to fix it. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sommers

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher not only works great, but it amuses the nerd in me and makes throwing beverage cans away fun. I found you really need to drill some pilot holes when installing because it has some really robust screws that can be hard to screw in and they don't intend to let go. It is much more attractive than cheaper models and much heavier built.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Works great when they use it
customer_reviews.text: whats to say, it's a can crusher, this model is sturdy and if you cant figurebit out then put the beer down you've had too many already. Just because you own it doesn't mean the wife will use the damn thing. Dip sticks will still toss the un crushed can in the bin right below the can crusher. Go figure
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The inside was built crooked.
customer_reviews.text: The inside mechanism that rests on top of the can is crooked. Because of this, when I crush a can, it sometimes shoots out of the Crusher. My grandparents had a few Crushers when I was growing up in the 1990’s and they were never crooked like this and worked better. It does the job, but takes longer than I expected it to.
customer_reviews.author: EonBlue

customer_reviews.title: Twisted metal!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted it and oiled it as direcrions required. It does not operate as it should. Tested it out first try and it just aint workin out. I jope this one was made crappy and I could get a different one. Really looked forward to using this!
customer_reviews.author: Corinne Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Works great, not easy to pull
customer_reviews.text: This works great - really great. It crushes cans down smaller than any crusher I've seen. However, it is not easy to use for everyone in my family. Some need to use two hands just to make it work and they can't crush cans all the way down.
customer_reviews.author: C. Medenwaldt

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It's easy for an adult to use. I had hopes that my kids could use this to do all the can crushing, but it's a little too tough for them. My 8 year old can do it with both hands, but the younger kids have to really strain. Other than that, it works great and we have made a lot more room in our aluminum recycling bin!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond K.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS (NOT RETURNABLE)
customer_reviews.text: The guts to this are off center causing massive friction when trying to use. Takes around 30lbs of force just to operate. I have no doubt this is just a random defect that affects a small portion of this companies product but it is NOT RETURNABLE!! So if you are the lucky fool to get the messed up ones you are out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase this product for my husband based on the reviews. A lot of other cheaper can crusher seemed to have a common link: Breaking too easily. We received the package and the package was in wonderful shape. After opening the box and trying out a few cans, we've concluded that this crusher is an excellent purchase. Very heavy duty and comes with its own nails to be mounted. Best can crusher on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney G

customer_reviews.title: This crusher does an OK job.
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher is good, but I have a problem with cans slipping off the platform. It does a great job of crushing the cans, but the cans have to be kind of held on the platform so that they don't slip out and need to be recrushed. This makes it a little difficult to crush several cans rapidly, but Ive learned to deal with it. Just have to guide them and keep your hands clear.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Brow

customer_reviews.title: It's a no brainer buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I just received my 1st replacement for this crusher, an exact model. I wore out my first one it lasted 25 years! This product is outstanding and very durable. Enough said, I highly recommend it for your can recycling.
customer_reviews.author: RonP

customer_reviews.title: Crushes cans like none other
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my folk's garage. Not much to say. It works well. One could say it CRUSHES. I'll leave you with a joke that works much better audibly than visually, but here it is nonetheless. "I once had a job crushing cans at the local recycling center. I ended up quitting not too long after. The job was just soda pressing!"
customer_reviews.author: Jake R

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading a bunch of reviews for this, and other can crushers. This is a very good unit. One drawback is that the mechanism inside the crusher scrapes the paint (and maybe a little metal) off of the inside of the housing, as it travels up and down. A little oil helps it run smoothly, and cans are reduced to about a quarter inch high with little effort. Definitely worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Marktigg

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: This is my second crusher. The first is still working great after almost 30 yrs. The new one is for a friends river lot. Very sturdy built crushes 16 oz too. Mine has crushed thousands of cans and still going strong. Solid as a rock and 2 mins to hang.
customer_reviews.author: USMCShoey

customer_reviews.title: Mechanism broke on the first can.
customer_reviews.text: There is a small steel bar that connects the inside 'piston' that crushes the cans to the handle. After installing, I used it to crush one can of White Claw, and the steel bar fell out of place and cannot be reconnected, rendering the entire thing useless. Save your money, and buy a different crusher.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: WD40 helps it to close easier!
customer_reviews.text: At first, this crusher was impossible to crush cans. So I asked for a refund from amazon. (Since this company doesn’t do refunds/returns). They refunded my money BUT then my husband told me to try WD40 and it loosened up the ‘joints’ and now it works awesome! I even called amazon to charge me again because I didn’t return it and works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Andru Small

customer_reviews.title: Great Can Crusher!
customer_reviews.text: We have had our "The Crusher" for about a month now. It is sturdy and works great! We have used this primarily on 12 oz. soda pop cans and the tall skinny 12 oz. cans of spiked seltzer waters. This machine crushes both of them easily. Just put a little dent in the middle of the can and have at it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I guess I didn’t read the reviews closely enough before I purchased this. After a couple weeks use, crushing maybe 50 or less cans, the crusher bent out of shape and started coming apart. Upon closer inspection I found the screws provided, which had been ,ousted with a handheld drill. had bent the unit out of shape. Something that will be used for crushing should be mountable with a power tool. A more rigid backplate would have easily prevented the failure. Crushed cans for sure. Check the reviews, try the mods.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Quality job
customer_reviews.text: Our cheaper can crusher broke, and I had this one for me to use in the big bathroom. It is sturdy, well made and even attractive. My husband stole mine so I ordered a replacement. It also works very well without having to be Hercules.
customer_reviews.author: david conrad

customer_reviews.title: Great can crusher
customer_reviews.text: The Crusher was easy to install (it included a template!) and works great. I love that it is solidly made (no plastic parts) and simple to use. My only nit is that some times the cans, after being crushed, get hung up in the screw head that is used for mounting it to the wall. I found that if I 'completely' crush the can, that eliminates the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: With shelter in place order due to Covid-19, i am been drinking sodas non stop. Need to save space storing all the recyclable empty cans and this works great in crushing them up
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works ok for a while but then it didn't
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few months but the moving crusher part won't stay inside anymore. I bought this one because it was made of metal and looked pretty sturdy but that turned out to not be the case.
customer_reviews.author: D. Walls

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Does the job. My only wish would be for an adjustment mechanism in the linkage. I feel like the cans could be compacted just a little more for additional space savings in the recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: The Crusher, Pacific Precision Metals Aluminum Can Compactor, White
product_meta.description: Size:Pacific Precision Metals THE CRUSHER Aluminum Can CompactorThe Aluminum Can Crusher instantly crushes most cans to about 1 inch. Simply hold the handle and pull it down. Even more, the sturdy all-steel construction is durable. Save valuable space both where you store the cans and when you transport them. Now you can haul 5 times as many aluminum cans. It means you'll have less trips to the recycling center and each trip will be worth more money. Best of all, you'll be doing your part to help the environment. Recycling is fun and easier than ever with the Crusher.
feature_bullets: Make the recycling process more efficient with The Aluminum Can Crusher
Instantly crushes all 12- and 16-ounce cans to about 1 inch, so space is saved when storing and transporting them
Sturdy all-steel construction is durable, with an easy-to-grab handle that makes it easy to operate
Simply hold the crusher's handle and pull it down to crush a can
Easy to hang on the wall and measures approximately 16 inches long

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,856 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
